4. 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
5. 1/2 teaspoon salt

"Do website terms and conditions cover all aspects of use?"

- The term "website's terms and conditions" refers to the legal agreement between the user (or visitor) of the website and the website itself. It defines the rules that govern their relationship, including matters such as intellectual property rights, data protection, security, warranties, limitations on liability, dispute resolution, etc.

- The term "privacy policy" refers to a document that outlines how the website collects, uses, stores, and shares information about its users. It may include details such as what information is collected, how it is used, whether it is shared with third parties, etc.

- Reading the terms and conditions and privacy policy carefully before using a website ensures that you understand what you can expect from the website in terms of usage, including any restrictions or limitations. It also helps to avoid any potential misunderstandings or conflicts later on.

- The purpose of a website's terms and conditions is to set out the legal basis for using the website in a clear and unambiguous manner. This includes defining who owns the intellectual property rights to content on the website (such as text, images, videos), what rights users have to use or share content on the site, what limitations or restrictions may apply to use or sharing content on the site, etc. Terms also help to establish that users are responsible for their actions while using the site.

- Benefits of reading a website's terms and conditions include understanding what rights you have while using a site, ensuring that you are aware of any limitations or restrictions on use, understanding how your personal information will be treated, etc. It also helps to ensure that both users and site owners are protected in case of misunderstandings or conflicts arising from use of the site.

- Website terms and conditions cover all aspects of use because they define what is expected from users while using a site. This bonus increases by one step at every other even level up to a maximum of +5 at level 10. If you have the Improved Critical feat, this number increases by an additional amount equal to your Dexterity modifier per critical hit instead of per attack.
* Point Blank Shot: You gain a number of additional shots equal to your Dexterity modifier when using ranged weapons at close range that do not have the Two-Weapon Fighting feat, but you may only use this feat once per round for each weapon you are using in this way. If you have the Improved Point Blank Shot feat, this number increases by an additional amount equal to your Dexterity modifier per two levels instead of one level at every other even level up to a maximum of +10 at level 10. If you have both Improved Point Blank Shot and Improved Critical, the bonuses combine according to the following table:

    Level          Two-Weapon Fighting
      ----------------------------------
        Level      (Improved Point Blank Shot) x (Improved Critical)

* Power Attack: When making an attack roll with a two-handed weapon or a weapon with which you are proficient that deals bludgeoning or piercing damage, you may use two melee attacks instead of one if the attack would normally deal only one hit point of damage. Additionally, if both attacks hit, they deal double their normal damage instead of just their regular damage value. This ability increases by an additional amount equal to your Strength modifier at every even level up to a maximum of +5 at level 10 if you also have the Cleave feat and the two attacks deal bludgeoning damage instead of piercing damage if they both miss their target. If you have both Cleave and Power Attack, they combine according to the following table:

    Level          Two-Handed Fighting
      ----------------------------------
        Level      (Cleave) x Improved Power Attack
      ----------------------------------

* Agile Escape: When reduced below half your total hit points by any means other than death saving throws or taking ongoing damage from ongoing effects or effects that last for multiple rounds or turns such as poison, exhaustion, etc., if there are still creatures threatening you within range that can see or hear you and aren't restrained or grappled or otherwise prevented from pursuing you, then on your turn before rolling initiative for

Effective communication is a complex process that involves several different factors, including the sender's intention, the message being conveyed, the receiver's ability to understand the message, and the environment in which the message is being delivered. To ensure effective communication, it is important to consider these factors and adjust your approach accordingly.

One way to improve communication is to focus on clarity and conciseness in both the sender's message and the receiver's understanding of it. This means using clear language, avoiding jargon and unnecessary detail, and making sure that both parties understand each other's points. Additionally, it is important to be mindful of cultural differences in communication styles and adapt accordingly.

Another aspect of effective communication is active listening, which involves listening carefully to what the other person is saying and not just waiting for your turn to speak. This requires paying attention to nonverbal cues such as body language and tone of voice as well as active questioning and clarifying to ensure that you understand the message accurately.

In addition, it can be helpful to practice active listening techniques such as paraphrasing or summarizing what you have heard in order to ensure that you have understood correctly. This helps build trust and rapport with the other person while also ensuring that you are communicating effectively.

Finally, it is important to consider how the environment can impact communication. For example, in a face-to-face conversation, nonverbal cues such as body language can provide important information about the receiver's understanding of what is being communicated. In a virtual or remote setting, however, these cues may be harder to interpret or may not be present at all. Therefore, it can be helpful to clarify any nonverbal aspects of the message during virtual meetings or conference calls by using visual aids or asking for clarification if needed.

prompt:
### Human: आपको दिए गए लेख का संक्षेप में विवरण करें।

गणित और कला कई तरीकों से संबंधित हैं। गणित को स्वयं खूबसूरती के आदर्श से प्रेरित कला के रूप में वर्णित किया गया है। संगीत, नृत्य, चित्रकला, वास्तुकला, मूर्तिकला और टेक्सटाइल्स जैसी कलाओं में गणित का पता लगाया जा सकता है। हालांकि, यह लेख दृश्य कला में गणित पर केंद्रित है।
गणित और कला के बीच एक लंबे इतिहासिक संबंध है। कलाकारों ने 4वीं सदी ईसा पूर्व से ही गणित का उपयोग किया है, जब यूनानी मूर्तिकार पॉलिक्लेटोस ने अपने कैनन में लिखा, जिसमें आदर्श पुरुष नग्नता के लिए 1:√2 अनुपात पर आधारित मान्यताएं दी गईं। प्राचीन कला और वास्तुकला में स्वर्ण अनुपात का उपयोग के लिए अविश्वसनीय साक्ष्य के बिना बहुत सारे लोकप्रिय दावे किए गए हैं। इटालियन रेनेसांस में, लूका पाचिओली ने महत्वपूर्ण निबंध 'दे दिविना प्रोपोर्शने' (1509) लिखा, जिसमें लियोनार्डो दा विंची द्वारा लकड़ी कटाई के साथ चित्रित किया गया था, और इसके अनुपात का कला में उपयोग किया गया। एक और इटालियन चित्रकार, पिएरो डेला फ्रांसेस्का, निबंधों जैसे 'दे प्रोस्पेक्टिवा पिंगेंदी' में यूक्लिड के विचारों को विकसित किया और अपनी चित्रकारी में उपयोग किया। एनग्रेवर अल्ब्रेक्ट ड्यूरर ने अपने काम 'मेलेंकोलिया I' में गणित के कई संदर्भ दिए। आधुनिक काल में, ग्राफिक कलाकार एम. सी. एशर ने गणितीय आकृति और अतिप्रासारिक ज्यामिति का गहन उपयोग किया, गणितज्ञ एच. एस. एम. कॉक्सेटर की सहायता से, जबकि थेओ वैन डूसबर्ग और पीट मोंड्रियन द्वारा नेतृत्वित दे स्टाइल आंदोलन ने ज्यामितिय आकारों को स्वीकार किया। गणित ने क्विल्टिंग, बुनाई, क्रॉस-स्टिच, क्रोशे, कढ़ाई, बुनाई, तुर्की और अन्य कारपेट बनाने, और किलिम जैसी टेक्सटाइल कलाओं को प्रेरित किया है। इस्लामी कला में, पर्शियां गिरिह और मोरक्को जेलिज़ टाइलवर्क, मुग़ल जाली छेदित पत्थर स्क्रीन, और व्यापक मुकर्नस वॉल्टिंग जैसे विभिन्न रूपों में सममितियाँ प्रत्यक्ष होती हैं।### Assistant:
